data.title: debug - commands should be disabled while being busy
data.body:
- take the scenario from #5811
- it seems the UI doesn't reflect what the backend is doing. I can feel from slow UI updates that operations take a long time but the stepping/continue/etc actions don't represent that. I would expect that during the time a request is being processed those actions are disabled

data.title: debug - large array not abbreviated
Debug hover doesn't show 'Generator'
Debug threads need more UI affordances
data.body:
Testing #5644

The list is too empty. At first glance, it's even not so trivial to understand that I'm looking at threads.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/14813949/63205b84-0ba4-11e6-93e5-21e5b7e15489.png)

Idea: We could use some kind of label to the right of each thread. Use a default value of `Thread`. Let each debug adapter overwrite that value. The C# one could for example say `Main Thread`, `Worker Thread #1`, etc...

data.title: Sort results in "Go to file" by how close they are to the working file (usability)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Sometimes I have files with the same name in different folders. When I work on something and want to open a file I prefer the file in the same folder to appear first in the list. Now it's sorted (probably) alphabetically.

When working on file `foo/something.js` and searching for "lorem", the list in Go to file should look like:
- foo/lorem.js
- bar/lorem.js

When working on file `bar/something.js` and searching for "lorem" it should be the other way round:
- bar/lorem.js
- foo/lorem.js

data.title: ux - merge debug output into output
data.body: we have _Debug Output_ and _Output_. The latter isn't output but a container for output channels like _Task_, _Git_, etc. It's actually configurable. So, my question is why doesn't debug fit into this and needs it own container? On the downside there is clear more view management with todays implementation as it makes me switch between debug output and output>something.

data.title: dataloss with vscode.openFolder
data.body:
#5338
- start with `yo code` sample
- change the command such that it opens a new workspace in the same folder
- start the debuggee
- make sure auto-save is off and make a chance such that a file is dirty
- run the command that opens a new folder
- ⚡ I don't get asked to save and lose my chance

data.title: Any way to add google analytics code in extension to get manually reports
data.body:
Hi , 
Is there any way to get the extension user usage from Google Analytics or any other 3rd party tool by integrating the code in Extension code.

data.title: Dismissing a workbench message doesn't wrap up API promise
data.body:
Testing #5743

The promise returned by `vscode.window.showInformationMessage()` never completes if the user dismisses it with <kbd>Escape</kbd>.

I expected it to complete with `undefined`, similarly to when pressing `Close`.

data.title: Open file/folder dialog needs to know its target window
data.body:
#5338
- start with `yo code`
- change the command to be like shown below
- set a break point on the `executeCommand`
- run, breakpoint hit, chose a folder
- ⚡ instead of the debuggee window the dev window opens a new folder

```
  // Display a message box to the user
  vscode.commands.executeCommand('vscode.openFolder');
```

data.title: Repetitive problem message when pointing to problem line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In one header create warning message
2. Include this header into multiple files
3. Compile and go, to problem Mach in this header
4. Problem message shows a list repetitive messages

It is strange to see list of problem messages that are the same.

- OS Version: windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Compile project with errors or warnings
2. Go to problem
3. When pointing on problem line there is yellow bulb that tells add to include path.

data.title: suggest
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10 14328

(in Chinese)
1. [HTML] 属性在输入 = 号时，自动补全 " "
2. [HTML] 智能提示 url 补全，如 script / link / img 等标签的 src=" "  或 href=" "，支持提示文件夹内的文件列表。
3. [HTML] 支持 style=" " 的样式智能提示
4. [HTML] 修改开始标签时，自动同时修改关闭标签，反之亦然
5. [VSCode - Side Bar - Explorer] 右击 HTML 文件增加菜单 "使用浏览器打开(IE/Chrome .e.g.)
6. [Editor] 编辑器中的文本鼠标拖拽位置
7. [VSCode] 文件另存为网页/图片
8. [CSS] 支持点击颜色值显示颜色选择对话框
9. [CSS] 支持图片转 base64 编码字符串
10. [VSCode - Side Bar - Explorer] 支持类似 ASP.NET 的文件关联显示，如：

```
index.aspx (可折叠)
     index.aspx.cs

对于 TS 文件则可以：
app.ts
    app.js
         app.min.js
```

data.title: Feature Request: Browser debugging with javascript coming off different subdomain
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Win7 Professional 64bit
- Umbraco v4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Your local webroot: <drive>:\ <webroot>\ <yoursite>
2. Your local js directory: <drive>:\ <webroot>\ <yoursite>\ <jspath>\file.js
3. Your local website: http://abc.xyz.something/ pointing to yoursite (you may have multiple subdomains pointing to different sites, umbraco style)
4. Your javascript delivery: http://js.xyz.something/ <jspath>/file.js
5. Firing chrome browser debugger on http://abc.xyz.something/ will start Chrome and goes to the page but can't hook onto the javascript, potentially because of routing confusion?

Suggestion:
Improve chrome browser debugging to allow for custom subdomain/host binding so that browser debugging will hook properly

data.title: Clicking a stack frame with no source causes all other thread stacks to collapse
data.body:
- VSCode Version: master (b2f6194)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Compile https://gist.github.com/edumunoz/6e2ca90d4b5d3dbfa5340576e79ac113 with `g++ -g -std=c++11 -pthread hello.cpp -o hello`
2. Install the [C++ debug adapter](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.cpptools)
3. Set a breakpoint on line 7 (the body of the `test` function)
4. When the breakpoint is hit, expand all the threads so you can see their stack frames
5. Click a stack frame that doesn't have source (e.g. `clone` or `create_thread`)

At this point, all threads except the one with the frame that was clicked collapse.  Clicking a stack frame that has symbols (e.g. `main()` or `test()`) doesn't cause any any other threads to collapse.

I would expect that the code view would change to the "Source ... is not available" view without collapsing any of my expanded threads.

@isidorn @weinand

data.title: Manually restoring modified file back to saved state requires save
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10 / Ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file with some code and save. For example

``` javascript
var test = "test"
```
1. Delete and re-type "test"

Actual:
Even though the file is restored back to its saved state, it still requires a save. This is the same behavior as VS Full, but Atom supports remembering the saved state and does not require save if the file is restored to the saved state.
